channel.title: SPZ News Feed - Top Stories
channel.description: Curated news from top Israeli and international sources (ynet, Israel Hayom, BBC)

item.title: [BREAKING] What we know about the joint US-Israel attack on Iran
item.description: Donald Trump has described "major combat operations", with explosions heard across Iran. Military action has begun. This is a major escalation from previous reports.

item.title: [VIDEO] Smoke rises in Tehran as explosions heard across country
item.description: The BBC's Jon Donnison reports from Jerusalem as Trump says "major combat operations" have begun. VIDEO: Live footage of smoke rising over Tehran.

item.title: Trump orders government to stop using Anthropic in battle over AI use
item.description: The move announced on social media comes after a standoff between Anthropic's boss and the US Department of Defense. Tech/AI policy news with major implications.

item.title: Bill Clinton asked about hot tub photo and testifies he knew 'nothing' of Epstein crimes
item.description: The former president told the committee that he would never have flown on Epstein's plane if he "had any inkling of what he was doing". DOJ deposition testimony.

item.title: OpenAI vows safety policy changes after Tumbler Ridge shooting
item.description: Canada's AI minister will meet CEO Sam Altman next week after the suspect's ChatGPT account was not flagged to police despite internal company concerns.

item.title: At least 15 killed after military plane carrying banknotes crashes in Bolivia
item.description: Police fire tear gas to disperse crowds allegedly trying to take banknotes from the crash site.

item.title: Pakistan defence minister says country in 'open war' with Afghanistan after strikes
item.description: The latest attacks by Pakistan follow months of clashes between the two countries, despite agreeing to a fragile ceasefire in October.

item.title: Aid groups in Gaza and West Bank thrown lifeline as Israel court pauses ban threat
item.description: Dozens of well-known groups faced shutdown under a new Israeli law, although the reprieve might be temporary.

item.title: The AI videos supercharging Russia's online disinformation campaigns
item.description: Security experts have warned that Western governments are poorly equipped to counter a new frontier of online disinformation.

item.title: Starmer vows to fight on after historic Green by-election win
item.description: The result - in a seat Labour has held for nearly 100 years - heaps further pressure on the PM's position.

item.title: 'They seized everything': Yemen's Houthi rebels drive aid groups to the brink
item.description: Aid groups - a lifeline for millions of Yemenis - are being squeezed out of existence in areas under the control of the rebels, the BBC hears.

item.title: Drone jammed near French aircraft carrier was Russian, says Sweden
item.description: Sweden's prime minister said it was a serious but not unexpected incident - and a "Russian way of acting that we recognise from other places".

item.title: Tram derails in Milan, leaving two dead and dozens injured
item.description: The crowded tram was travelling in the centre of Milan at rush hour when it appeared to crash into the side of a building.
